page.title: 03A WALK IN THE SEISDON AREA
page.content: A public footpath runs the length of Abbot's Castle Hill and affords very good views of the land on either side, mainly a patchwork of different coloured fields, bounded by hedges, with the occasional house or group of cottages dotted about the landscape. More distant views take in the villages of Seisdon, Trysull and Wombourne and the western side of Wolverhampton. In another direction Pattingham village shows up well, the Wrekin can usually be seen and even the Long Mynd on clear days. On the middle of the ridge stands a house called "Tinker's Castle". At one time its wine cellar was a cave occupied by a so-called "hermit" who was actually a knife-grinder by trade and a herbalist who supplied the lcal girls with love potions.
